pullRequest.title: Avoid displaying notification if user not calls display()
pullRequest.bodyText:
If display() is not called on notificationProcessing under NotificationProcessingHandler service, notification should not display and the foreground handler should not be called.



This change is

beforeCommit.message:
Avoid displaying notification if user not call display() under extender service

  * If display() is not called on notificationProcessing under NotificationProcessingHandler service, notification should not display
    and foreground handler should not be called.

afterCommit.message:
Avoid displaying notification if user not calls display()

  * If display() is not called on notificationProcessing under NotificationProcessingHandler service, notification should not display and foreground handler should not be called.

nodes.bodyText: The boolean internalComplete was added to OSNotificationReceived in this PR. I think we should use this name here to keep it consistent.
Should have threadAndTaskWait(); or something here to wait for the timeout to fire.

commit.message:
Avoid displaying notification if user not calls display()

  * If display() is not called on notificationProcessing under NotificationProcessingHandler service, notification should not display and foreground handler should not be called.

Set up NotificationProcessingHandler even if remote params or privacy consent is granted (#1138)

* setupNotificationExtensionServiceClass method must be called even if remote params aren't called, in that way the user service callback is called
  * If privacy consent isn't granted then subscription shouldn't happen then notifications will not arrive, because of that it is safe to init service even if we don't have remote params or privacy consent

beforeCommit.message:
Set up NotificationProcessingHandler even if remote params or privacy consent is granted (#1138)

* setupNotificationExtensionServiceClass method must be called even if remote params aren't called, in that way the user service callback is called
  * If privacy consent isn't granted then subscription shouldn't happen then notifications will not arrive, because of that it is safe to init service even if we don't have remote params or privacy consent

afterCommit.message:
Set up NotificationProcessingHandler even if remote params or privacy consent is granted (#1138)

* setupNotificationExtensionServiceClass method must be called even if remote params aren't called, in that way the user service callback is called
  * If privacy consent isn't granted then subscription shouldn't happen then notifications will not arrive, because of that it is safe to init service even if we don't have remote params or privacy consent
